Asian Americans in the U.S.  Find out more on Asian Americans in the U.S. and the research framework CSAAH uses to guide its work   History of CSAAH  From 2003 to present CSAAH has made leaps and strides in its efforts to eliminate health disparities in Asian American communities.   Community Based Participatory Research  Find out more about community-oriented frameworks for addressing health disparities among Asian Americans.   Community Health Workers (CHW)  Several initiatives promote the community health worker model to build capacity and leadership in diverse communities.   Research Framework  The Research Core examines the major health disparities facing Asian American communities and investigates innovative models to improve the health of this population.   Infrastructure & Funding  The Center is supported by various grants which support research, training, and partnership development to improve the health of Asian American communities.                                                                                        NYU Langone Medical Center       Student Login       Library                 Policies & Disclaimers

Asian Americans in the U.S. | NYU Center for the Study of Asian American Health                                Skip to main content                      Patient Care       Faculty & Staff Directory       Events       Careers       Donate                                                                                                                                                                             NYU Center for the Study of Asian American Health                                                                                  Home   About Us   Research   Education & Training   Dissemination   Partnerships   News & Events                                  Home About Us Asian Americans in the U.S.            Print  Email               - A + A                                         About Us      Asian Americans in the U.S.     open/close   People   History of CSAAH   Community Based Participatory Research     open/close   Community Health Workers  Community Health Worker Resources       open/close   Research Framework  Cardiovascular Disease   Tumorigenesis   Mental Health   Cultural & Social Determinants     Infrastructure & Funding   Contact Us                                                                                                    Asian Americans in the U.S.                                                      According to the 2010 Census, the Asian American population grew faster than any other racial/ethnic group between 2000 and 2010, with the population who reported Asian alone increased by 43 percent. There are approximately 17.3 million Asian Americans in the United States (U.S.), representing 5.6% of the U.S. population. By the year 2050 this population is projected to grow to 43.2 million or 10% of the overall U.S. population. Asian Americans represent a diverse community comprising of more than 30 countries of origin and various cultures, traditional beliefs, religions, years in the U.S., degrees of acculturation, levels of English proficiency, and socioeconomic status.   New York City (NYC) is the home to nearly 1.2 million documented and undocumented Asian Americans, representing more than 13% of the total NYC population.  NYC’s Asian American population grew by 110% from 1990 to 2010.  The Asian American population in NYC is tremendously diverse, comprising of individuals representing more than 20 countries and 45 languages and dialects.  Many of NYC’s Asian American populations experience high rates of limited English proficiency (LEP) and other language barriers.          Source: Interactive Map published by the NY Times on "Asians in New York City"   For more information on Asian American demographic characteristics in the U.S. and New York City and nationally, see the following resources.   View/Download PDFs   CSAAH_AANHPI Data Slides.pdf Asian Pacific American New Yorkers Count Report.pdf                                                                                        NYU Langone Medical Center       Student Login       Library                 Policies & Disclaimers
